title: The Block's Deb Saunders feels the wrath of FURIOUS foreman Keith after stealing prank
text:
The Block's Deb Saunders is in hot water this week after she copped a telling off from foreman, Keith Schleiger.

Deb, 46, decided to play a sneaky prank on the show's head honcho by stealing the hammer from his workbelt.

But sour-faced Keith was less than amused when he discovered Deb's sly antics.

Hot water! The Block's foreman Keith Schleiger (pictured) was less than amused when he discovered Deb Saunders' cheeky antics

According to TV Week, the building manager looked furious as he realised what had happened.

He raged: 'You never, ever steal a carpenter's hammer.'

The practical joke is set to air on Channel Nine this week, promising to inject some tension into the hit renovation show.

It came about when the wife of stand-up comedian Andy Saunders was in the middle of a task involving nails and needed a hammer.

Sneaky! The Block's Deb Saunders (pictured with husband Andy) decided to play a sneaky prank on the show's head honcho by stealing the hammer from his workbelt

Keith's sidekick Dan Reilly suggests the foreman wouldn't mind if Deb quickly borrowed his tools.

But unfortunately for Deb, he couldn't have been more wrong.

As Dan distracts Keith, Deb seizes her moment to snatch the hammer from his belt while the foreman's back is turned.

She can barely contain her laughter after the cheeky move, but it's not long before she faces Keith's wrath.

It comes after The Block judge Shaynna Blaze was reduced to tears by Andy and Deb's 'healing' bedroom in Sunday's episode.

The 56-year-old interior design expert was momentarily speechless as she took a look around the beautifully crafted space.

'I can't talk...,' she told Neale and Darren, before saying: 'This is stunning... wow. It's so gentle.'

Emotional: The Block judge Shaynna Blaze (pictured) was reduced to tears by Andy and Deb's 'healing' bedroom in Sunday's episode

Welling up in tears, Shaynna added: 'I just think, you know when a house is built with love and I think that's what I'm connecting with at the moment.'

Andy and Deb previously faced a tough reality check when they realised they didn't have enough money to make it to the end of the season.

In tense scenes, they realised their cash-flow was quickly running out, prompting questions as to how they would finish their renovation.

This season of The Block sees five celeb couples tackling the Oslo Hotel - a rundown backpackers accommodation in St Kilda, Melbourne.

The Block continues Monday at 7.30pm on Channel Nine.
